alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:59AM PST until January 08 at 9:32PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain over the Southwest Interior plus low level snow melt pushed the Skookumchuck River at Centralia above flood stage early Friday morning. The river will continue to rise today cresting in major flood stage tonight. The river will slowly recede Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River At Centralia. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 191.5 feet, the Skookumchuck River will cause severe flooding in Centralia and the surrounding area. The river will flood most residential areas and roads and cover most of the farmland in the Skookumchuck River valley. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Skookumchuck River Basin. This stage corresponds to a Phase 4 flood in the Lewis County flood warning system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Friday the stage was 189.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM PST Friday was 189.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 192.8 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 189.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 200 PM PST.
